channel.description: Design engineering services by service design and business architecture

item.title: Priority Queue - Designing Ryanair's Boarding Pass
item.description:
Priority Queue - Designing Ryanair's Boarding Pass

The History of Ryanair's Boarding Pass The humble boarding pass, up until the mid 2000's was just a simple document to get you from the check-in desk to your airplane seat. Gate Number? Check. Seat Number? Check. Ample time to peruse the shops and sip a fine Italian macchiato while you waited for flight number to be called.

item.title: Practical Service Design - guides, resources, and community
item.description:
Practical Service Design - guides, resources, and community

Our world is now made of services. We need new tools to think across this space, to not only create memorable and valuable experiences for our customers, but also empower our organizations to change the way we do business for the better.

item.title: Video: What is service design?
item.description:
Video: What is service design?

Design Methods Step 1: Discover Step one in a four-part guide for anyone who wants to understand the methods designers use and try them out for themselves. Discover - keep your perspectives wide, allowing for a broad range of ideas and influences.

item.title: Katie Koch // Putting Service Design Into Practice // Service Experience Conference 2015
item.description:
Katie Koch // Putting Service Design Into Practice // Service Experience Conference 2015

item.title: Stop overthinking UX and try the coffee shop test
item.description:
Stop overthinking UX and try the coffee shop test

If you work in product development you hear a lot about user interface (UI) and user experience (UX). When people don't really know what they are talking about, they use these terms interchangeably, along with buzz phrases like "human-centric design," "process guided customer control groups," and "brand-focused KPIs synergistic with user needs."

item.title: New Tendencies in Web Design
item.description:
New Tendencies in Web Design

I have talked a lot about what I think the new trends of design for the web are. I shared a few projects that had some of the elements and styles that I believe are becoming the new trend in web design.

item.title: UI Inspiration: Mobile Interactions
item.description:
UI Inspiration: Mobile Interactions

In one of my previous articles, I mentioned that we will see more and more subtle interactions in the upcoming weeks and year.

item.title: Content-First Prototyping - Smashing Magazine
item.description:
Content-First Prototyping - Smashing Magazine

Content is the core commodity of the digital economy. It is the gold we fashion into luxury experience, the diamond we encase in loyalty programs and upsells. Yet, as designers, we often plug it in after the fact. We prototype our interaction and visual design to exhaustion, but accept that the "real words" can just be dropped in later.

item.title: Resource Cards - Selected free resources for designers
item.description:
Resource Cards - Selected free resources for designers

Resource Cards is a growing list of free resources aimed to help creatives with their next project.
